City Council Place 3
====================

RICARDO MILLER
--------------

### Background

Ricardo Miller was born and raised in The Bahamas and became an American citizen in 2010. He has dedicated 27 years to training and developing leaders in children's ministry and church leadership development. He has collaborated with esteemed Christian leaders like Dr. Tony Evans. As a certified Life Coach and CEO of Effective Living LLC, Ricardo, known as Coach Ricardo, shares his expertise through writing, with five books to his name.

Ricardo is a member of the Red Oak Chamber of Commerce and the Waxahachie Rotary Club. He served as School Board Chairman in The Bahamas and a founding board member at Legacy Preparatory Charter School in Dallas.  Ricardo is also a member of the Red Oak Library Advisory Board.

Ricardo served as the children’s pastor at Pathway Of Life Church in Dallas until 2019, and currently holds the position of Operations and Development Pastor. Ricardo is married to Karen and they have two children, RJ and Grace.

![Ricardo Miller](https://www.redoaktx.org/ImageRepository/Document?documentId=7808)

Term: 2024-2027

[Email Councilman Miller](mailto:rmiller@redoaktx.org)

1. Ad Valorem Tax Rate: Fiscal Year 2025 - 2026
   ============================================

   The City of Red Oak adopted a tax rate that will raise more taxes for maintenance and operations than last year's tax rate.  
   The tax rate will effectively be raised by 3.5 percent and will raise taxes for maintenance and operations on a $100,000 home by approximately $15.45
